title: Why isn't Jonathan Demme counted among the legendary directors even after directing the highly successful movie Silence of the Lambs? - Quora

response.answer_text: All of the legendary directors have created at least a handful of masterpieces - and most of them more. Jonathan Demme did create Silence of the Lamb and Philadelphia, but, for whatever reason, he didn’t get to create a lot of great movies after that. The only other movie of his that I have seen is The Manchurian Candidate, a remake, and that was just a so-so thriller, but nothing close to the other two. And of course it wasn’t as good as the original. By comparison Martin Scorsese remade Cape Fear with much more success.
